attributes.action: Ask the Andalucian Ministry of health to make British citizens exempt from their autonomous rule in refusing the transportation of the deceased
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The SPANISH autonomous region of ANDALUCIA which includes the resort of Benalmadena on the Costa Del Sol has a MINISTRY OF HEALTH ruling which means they can keep the body of any person who dies in that region for a minimum period of 5 years providing full decomposition has taken place, if not the body will be examined every 12 months until full decomposition has taken it's course, this means a wait of may be 6, 7 or even 8 years. Only then will the skeleton of the deceased be allowed to be returned to the place of the families wishes with the appropriate licence and permits. This rule includes BRITISH FAMILIES being refused the repatriation of their loved one's body.
BRITISH CITIZENS should be exempt from this rule and the family should be allowed the repatriation of the deceased immediately after the coroner and or pathologist has completed their reports.
BRITISH families should have the right to bury the BRITISH IN BRITIAN allowing the deceased to R.I.P and the family to have some closure.
